meanings.definition: (noun) the sum of a person's actions in this and previous states of existence, viewed as deciding their fate in future existences
meanings.sent1: Believing in karma, she knew that her good deeds would bring positivity back to her.
meanings.sent2: Many people think that karma means what goes around comes around.
meanings.sent3: When he accidentally knocked over the vase, he joked that it must be his bad karma catching up with him.
meanings.sent4: The concept of karma is like a boomerang, sending back to you what you put out into the world.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the character's karma caught up with him when he least expected it.

meanings.definition: (verb) to bring about one's own fate through one's actions
meanings.sent1: She believed that she could karma her way into success by working hard every day.
meanings.sent2: If you keep making excuses, you will only karma yourself into a corner.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could karma his way into winning the lottery by buying a ticket every day.
meanings.sent4: By putting in the effort, she was able to karma her way to achieving her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The character's determination to succeed allowed him to karma his way out of difficult situations.
